page.title: 02Nutscale Reservoir
page.content: Nutscale reservoir is set in a deep valley.It is not a popular reservoir for sport,but it is used for private trout fishing and the main wildlife is birds.It is also in the Natoinal Trust area. It was built in 1942 and supplies Minehead,Porlock and Porlock Weir.It has a capacity of 277 mega litres,an area of 8 acres and the length is 375 metres.The depth is 12.2 and the perimetre is 1140 metres. Water from the reservoir flows by pipeline to Porlock Treatmeant Works, which treats about 3 mega litres of water a day.
